newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak c.bank drains SKK7.4bln in rev repo tenders.
newsitem.headline: Slovak c.bank drains SKK7.4bln in rev repo tenders.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said it drained funds totalling 7.42 billion crowns through two securities reverse repurchase tenders on Thursday.
In the NBS's one-day reverse repo tender, the average rate slipped to 17.25 percent, after 17.4 percent in the previous reverse repo tender of a similar maturity on Wednesday.
In a seven-day repo tender, the average rate fell to 16.74 percent from 17.00 percent on Wednesday.
The NBS added the one-day tender was heavily oversubscribed, prompting it to shorten bids, with 6.57 billion crowns worth of bids from a shortened total of 8.63 billion being accepted.
"We had to shorten the last group of bids," Peter Andresic, a head of the NBS Open Market Operation Department told Reuters. He declined to immediately comment on the issue.
All bids for the seven-day tender totalling 850 million crowns were accepted.
